lexUnit.name: kneel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or rest on a knee or the knees.

sentence.text: She knelt down by the low window , put her head on her arms and cried bitterly .
It was a command , not a suggestion , and , though she resented being ordered about , she crossed and knelt beside him .
Cadfael kneeled close by the shattered head , and slid a hand gently under the right cheek , to turn the face a little upward to be seen .
Sent up early to the dormitory , I had to kneel naked by the side of my bed .
While they were eating , a woman who had a bad name crept into the room and knelt at the feet of Jesus .
And out of the crowd came this man who knelt before Jesus and pleaded for mercy for his son , an epileptic , who suffered terribly , was a danger to himself and to others .
Deciding that attack was the best form of defence , I knelt beside him and lowering my head to within inches of his , said , ` Next time , It 'll be the bread knife . "
Corbett went and knelt beside the man .
Almost against his own will , he knelt by the gap , and peered in .
Finally , she got up and knelt by the hole , which was the size of a penny .
Fand set her spear against the wall and knelt by Ruth , reaching out to touch her hand .
Theodora made her way up the chancel , genuflected briefly and knelt in the silent pew , praying for ` the soul of thy servant , Paul , his family and all who worship here " .
Then at eleven he kneels on the carpet
Sara knelt on the floor and began putting away the records Sandra had abandoned , carefully matching the right sleeve to each disc .
He kneels to PAMELA and offers her a bouquet of flowers . ]
Then my Cid alighted when he had said this , and the ladies knelt down before him , and kissed his hand , and wished him long life .
Christina kneeled down to pick up the handle of a cup .
The girl knelt down and began to play a game of marbles with the Doctor .
Philip knelt down beside him .
He knelt down beside the dog , staring into her face in the meagre light from the outer stairway .
Kragan knelt down in front of Adam and looked at him as a butcher would appraise a cut of meat .
Jelka went across and knelt over her , letting her hand rest on the woman 's arm .
He knelt up and leaned towards Lucien .
The Queen knelt again , as did most of the spectators , and as their prayers ended Mistress Lee , her lady-in-waiting , bound her eyes with a linen handkerchief .
He knelt easily , powerful arms moving smoothly with the paddle , his face , in profile to her as he studied something on shore , rugged and uncaring .
He knelt to check the old man 's pulse only to discover that the President was uncaring rather than unconscious .
I knelt and wiped a diamond pane with my sleeve .
